featured.text: The church was built with pine trees brought from the mainland, which was quite common for the 18th century.
Traders from Asia had already visited the islands 900 years before the arrival of its first permanent settlers from the African mainland (around 1000 AD).
Built under the sea in 1994, the _____ between England and France connects the UK more closely with mainland Europe.

Their voyage, down the coastline of northeastern mainland China, through the East China Sea, then down the Taiwan Strait and into the South China Sea, had been smooth until four days ago when the mainsail of their twin-mast sailboat “Kawasaki” was smashed by strong winds on the high seas.

definition.zh_def: 大陸，特指一個國家的主要陸地部分，通常與島嶼相對。
definition.en_def: The principal landmass of a country, often contrasted with islands.
definition.example: The mainland of China is vast and diverse.
